channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Harris gets back on the trail as Biden recovers from COVID
item.description: Vice President Harris was in Provincetown, Mass. raising money for the Biden-Harris campaign. Meanwhile, President Biden is stuck in Rehoboth Beach, Del., after COVID took him off the trail.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris was in Provincetown, Mass. raising money for the Biden-Harris campaign. Meanwhile, President Biden is stuck in Rehoboth Beach, Del., after COVID took him off the trail.

(Image credit: Nathan Howard/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: Bangladesh imposes strict curfew with a 'shoot-on-sight-order' following deadly protests
item.content:encoded: (Image credit: Rajib Dhar)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: American Airlines reaches agreement with flight attendant union, avoiding strike
item.content:encoded: (Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Remembering Rep. Sheila Jackson Lee of Texas
item.description: Texas congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee, a leading voice for progressive causes in the House, died Friday in Houston.
item.content:encoded: Texas congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee, a leading voice for progressive causes in the House, died Friday in Houston.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Schneider

item.title: Appalachian writer revisits J.D. Vance's 'Hillbilly Elegy'
item.description: NPR's Andrew Limbong speaks with Meredith McCarroll, co-editor of "Appalachian Reckoning: A Region Responds to Hillbilly Elegy," about the resonance and criticism of Sen. J.D. Vance's autobiography.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Andrew Limbong speaks with Meredith McCarroll, co-editor of "Appalachian Reckoning: A Region Responds to Hillbilly Elegy," about the resonance and criticism of Sen. J.D. Vance's autobiography.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Trump rallies in Michigan as Biden isolates
item.description: Former President Donald Trump is doing his first rally since an assassination attempt. President Biden is still off the trail, recovering from COVID.
item.content:encoded: Former President Donald Trump is doing his first rally since an assassination attempt. President Biden is still off the trail, recovering from COVID.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordo√±ez

item.title: Why is there so much hype over the new College Football '25 video game?
item.description: NPR's Andrew Limbong speaks with The Athletic's Chris Vannini about the new video game, College Football '25.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Andrew Limbong speaks with The Athletic's Chris Vannini about the new video game, College Football '25.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Life Kit offers tips on appreciating life's small joys
item.description: It's easy to stop noticing what we love about our lives. NPR's Life Kit has tips from cognitive neuroscientist Tali Sharot on how to fall back in love with life's small joys.
item.content:encoded: It's easy to stop noticing what we love about our lives. NPR's Life Kit has tips from cognitive neuroscientist Tali Sharot on how to fall back in love with life's small joys.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: Years after the Larry Nassar scandal, are Olympic athletes safe from abuse?
item.description: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Wall Street Journal reporter Louise Radnofsky about the U.S. Center for SafeSport, which opened its doors in 2017 in the wake of the Larry Nassar scandal.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Wall Street Journal reporter Louise Radnofsky about the U.S. Center for SafeSport, which opened its doors in 2017 in the wake of the Larry Nassar scandal.
item.dc:creator: Ari Shapiro

item.title: Shortwave podcast explores Pluto's planetary demotion
item.description: In this except from "Space Camp," a special series from NPR science podcast Short Wave, host Regina Barber delves into Pluto's demotion from planet to dwarf planet.
item.content:encoded: In this except from "Space Camp," a special series from NPR science podcast Short Wave, host Regina Barber delves into Pluto's demotion from planet to dwarf planet.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu
